# Recent Advances in Chemistry: A World of Molecules and Reactions

Chemistry, the central science, is essential for understanding the world around us. From new materials to drug development, chemistry plays a critical role. Here's a glimpse into some exciting recent developments.

## Customizing Light with Chiral Molecules

Researchers have made progress in customizing circularly polarized afterglow by using stepwise chiral amplification in BINAPs/BINAPOs. This has potential applications in various fields, including optics and materials science. [Learn more](https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2025/sc/d4sc08710k)

## The Future of Oral Medications

A team at The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio has made a breakthrough that could allow IV medications to be taken orally. This could transform the treatment of diseases like cancer and Alzheimer's. This has huge implications for medicinal chemistry. ## New Materials for Brain-Inspired Computing

A review article highlights the potential of 2D materials like molybdenum telluride in creating memristors for low-energy artificial synapses. This could pave the way for more efficient and powerful neuromorphic computing. This showcases the intersection of chemistry and advanced computing. [Learn more](https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2025/nr/d5nr01509j)

## Chromenochalcones: Promising Medicinal Compounds

Chromenochalcones are being explored for their medicinal properties. These compounds have a versatile structure that allows them to interact with biological systems, making them promising candidates for new drugs. [Learn more](https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2025/md/d5md00062a)
